body_html: I used a few layers of tf-slim pretrained model(resnet_v1_50.ckpt) as my CNN's base layers, then I added several more my own layers and trained the network, when I use saver.save, it worked well, but when I try to restore, it end up with the Data loss issue just as above said. I tried to use tf.train.Saver(write_version=1), and it at least worked.
body_text: I used a few layers of tf-slim pretrained model(resnet_v1_50.ckpt) as my CNN's base layers, then I added several more my own layers and trained the network, when I use saver.save, it worked well, but when I try to restore, it end up with the Data loss issue just as above said. body: I used a few layers of tf-slim pretrained model(resnet_v1_50.ckpt) as my CNN's base layers, then I added several more my own layers and trained the network, when I use `saver.save`, it worked well, but when I try to restore, it end up with the Data loss issue just as above said. I tried to use tf.train.Saver(write_version=1), and it at least worked.
